_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Facility Name: Carbide Technologies

Fraser, MI 48026

RMP Facility ID: 1000 0022 1725



Executive Summary



Carbide Technologies has prepared this executive summary in conformance with the provisions of 40 CFR 68.155.



1. Accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at the stationary source:



Carbide Technologies adheres to the Federal and State regulations and in compliance with the OSHA requirements for handling of anhydrous ammonia and the OSHA process management standard. Employees of the facilities are trained in their roles and responsibilities in implementing prevention and emergency response. Should an emergency occur, it the company's policy to notify the City of Fraser Fire Department and request that they respond to the emergency situation



2. Stationary source and regulated substances handled:



Anhydrous ammonia is stored in a bulk tank at the facility. The facility is a commercial heat treating facility.



3. The worst case release scenario and the alternative release scenario including the administrative controls and mitigation measures to limit the distances for release have been prepared and submitted as required. This data may be viewed onsite.





4. The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps:



The design, installation and maintenance of anhydrous ammonia tank is performed in conformance with ANSI standards, state and local regulations. Facility personnel have been trained in safe handling procedures of the chemical. The facility is in compliance with the applicable regulations. The loading of anhydrous ammonia is conducted with extreme safety. All the transfer operations are monitored and follow a written standard operating procedure (SOP)





5. The five-year accident history



None



6. The emergency response program:



In the event of an emergency, the facility will immediately notify the City of Fraser Fire Department for an emergency response measures.





7. P

lanned changes to improve safety



The Facility will train their employees on an ongoing basis. The safety systems and preventive measures are constantly evaluated and improved. This facility also expects to improve safety performance by emphasizing all elements of the PSM/RMP program.
